=====================================
Bibliography
=====================================

#. Foster, Robert Fitzroy. The Oxford Illustrated History of Ireland. OUP Oxford, 1989.

#. Ireland (Provisional government, 1916), Thomas James Clarke, Seán MacDiarmada, Padraic Pearse, James Connolly, Thomas MacDonagh, Éamonn Ceannt, Joseph Mary Plunkett, and Irish Republican Brotherhood. Poblacht Na h’Éireann = The Provisional Government of the Irish Republic to the People of Ireland. [Dublin]: [publisher not identified], 1916.

#. Murphy, Seamus. “Dark Liturgy, Bloody Praxis: The 1916 Rising.” Studies 105, no. 417 (n.d.). https://dialogueireland.files.wordpress.com/2016/05/1916_dark_liturgy.pdf.

#. O’Brien, Eugene. “Visioning Ireland: Pearse, Prosopopoeia and the Remembering of O’Donovan Rossa and Tone.” Nordic Irish Studies 13, no. 1 (2014): 1–17.

#. O’Leary, Philip. “‘What Stalked through the Post Office?’: Pearse’s Cú Chulainn.” Proceedings of the Harvard Celtic Colloquium 3 (1983): 21–38.

#. Pearse, Patrick. “The Dord Feinne.” Accessed November 29, 2017. https://celt.ucc.ie/published/E950004-021.html.

#. ———. “The Murder Machine.” Accessed November 29, 2017. http://www.cym.ie/documents/themurdermachine.pdf.

#. ———. “The New University: Irish Essential for Matriculation.” An Claidheamh Soluis. August 22, 1908.

#. ———. “The University and the Schools.” An Claidheamh Soluis. December 19, 1908.

#. Sisson, Elaine. “Scholarcast 2: The Boy as National Hero: The Legacy of CúChulainn.” Accessed November 29, 2017. http://www.ucd.ie/scholarcast/scholarcast2.html.

#. Walsh, Brendan. “‘Frankly and Robustly National’: Padraig Pearse, the Gaelic League and the Campaign for Irish at the National University.” Studies: An Irish Quarterly Review 103, no. 411 (2014): 318–30.

#. Zelenetz, Alan. “Education and the Gael: Pádraig Pearse’s ‘Scoil Éanna.’” Proceedings of the Harvard Celtic Colloquium 18/19 (1998): 445–56.

#. “Thousands Attend Easter Rising Parade.” BBC News, March 27, 2016, sec. Europe. http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-35905248.
